post.title: MySQL and phpMyAdmin on Fedora 16
post.resume: How to setup MySQL and phpMyAdmin on Fedora 16
post.content:
For my surprise, after installing MySQL server, there was no service mysqld in /etc/init.d, so i could not start mysql server with #/etc/init.d/mysqld start

class Voila {

}

Installation (mysql 5.5.16)

#yum install mysql-server

So it seems that now, to start a service with must run the command systemctl

#systemctl start mysqld.service
